articles.headline: As Paperwork Goes Missing, Private Student Loan Debts May Be Wiped Away
articles.snippet: In an echo of the subprime mortgage crisis, one of the largest owners of troubled student loans cannot collect because documents are missing.
articles.abstract: In an echo of the subprime mortgage crisis, one of the largest owners of troubled student loans cannot collect because documents are missing.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of people who took out private loans to pay for college but have not been able to keep up payments may get their debts wiped away because critical paperwork is missing.
articles.byline: By Stacy Cowley and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

articles.headline: Trump Says He Has Signed More Bills Than Any President, Ever. He Hasn’t.
articles.snippet: The president's legislative record for his first six months in office is about average among recent presidents. But he has time to compile major achievements.
articles.abstract: The president's legislative record for his first six months in office is about average among recent presidents. But he has time to compile major achievements.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — To hear President Trump tell it, his first six months in the White House should be judged in part by the legislation he has signed into law.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Karen Yourish

articles.headline: Health Care Overhaul Collapses as Two Republican Senators Defect
articles.snippet: With announced opposition from Senators Moran and Lee, the Republican push to rewrite President Obama’s signature domestic legacy issue falls short.
articles.abstract: With announced opposition from Senators Moran and Lee, the Republican push to rewrite President Obama’s signature domestic legacy issue falls short.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Two more Republican senators declared on Monday night that they would oppose the Senate Republican bill to repeal the Affordable Care Act, killing, for now, a seven-year-old promise to overturn President Barack Obama’s signature domestic achievement.

articles.headline: U.S. and Chinese Executives to Meet on Nations’ Economic Relations
articles.snippet: A meeting of more than 20 business leaders from the United States and China will focus on issues that trouble economic relations between the countries.
articles.abstract: A meeting of more than 20 business leaders from the United States and China will focus on issues that trouble economic relations between the countries.
articles.lead_paragraph: Leaders of major United States companies with deep ties to China will meet on Tuesday with their Chinese counterparts to try to ease the increasingly rocky economic relationship between the countries.

articles.headline: Why Nelson Peltz Wants P.&G. to See Him as a ‘Constructivist’
articles.snippet: The financier, who dislikes the term “activist,” has made his name by investing in companies using a friendlier approach. But he’s still an activist.
articles.abstract: The financier, who dislikes the term “activist,” has made his name by investing in companies using a friendlier approach. But he’s still an activist.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nelson Peltz hates being called an activist, let alone a corporate raider.

articles.headline: After Decades of War, Colombian Farmers Face a New Test: Peace
articles.snippet: The FARC rebels have disarmed and joined the government to wean farmers off illicit crops. But in poor villages, the lure of drug money is still strong.
articles.abstract: The FARC rebels have disarmed and joined the government to wean farmers off illicit crops. But in poor villages, the lure of drug money is still strong.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS RÍOS, Colombia — Every three months or so, Javier Tupaz, a father of six, heads downhill from his clapboard home to work in his cocaine laboratory.

articles.headline: China Disrupts WhatsApp Service in Online Clampdown
articles.snippet: Facebook’s last major consumer product in China was partly blocked as Beijing increases its grip on the internet.
articles.abstract: Facebook’s last major consumer product in China was partly blocked as Beijing increases its grip on the internet.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — The last of Facebook’s major products that still worked in China was disrupted by the government on Tuesday, as Beijing broadly tightened its controls over the internet.

articles.headline: In Health Care, Republicans Could Learn From Rwanda
articles.snippet: While Obamacare’s foes seek to reverse its expansion of coverage, third-world nations have made strides in extending access and improving results.
articles.abstract: While Obamacare’s foes seek to reverse its expansion of coverage, third-world nations have made strides in extending access and improving results.
articles.lead_paragraph: Republicans, you are probably tired of hearing how so many Americans are sicker than their peers in other rich countries, lacking access to needed medical care. There are only so many times one can take being unfavorably compared to Denmark.
